text: Kalua Pork Sliders Pre-heat your oven to 325 degrees F or 160 degrees C.  Cut long and shallow cuts into the pork butt. Rub the liquid smoke and salt into the pork. Use the banana leaf to wrap the pork around. Secure it with kitchen twine and then repeat with foil. Pour about an inch of water into a roasting pan. Roast the pork for about 3 1/2 hours (or 45 minutes for each pound). Shred the pork with forks and mix it into the BBQ sauce. Scoop on Hawaiian taro rolls or sweet bread, with a side of coleslaw. Lilikoi Pineapple BBQ Sauce Set aside the lilikoi juice.  Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan. Whisk mixture and boil until the sauce achieves thickness. Lower the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. Pour in the lilikoi juice and reduce to 2 cups.  Pineapple Cole Slaw Combine the pineapple juice, mayonnaise, sugar, ginger, and vinegar together.  Mix thoroughly with the chopped pineapple, cabbage, and carrots.
